mcqs.question: What is the difference between an HTML element and an HTML tag?
options: An element includes the start tag, content, and end tag; a tag is just the markup
A tag includes the content, an element does not
An element only refers to self-closing tags
mcqs.explanation: An HTML element includes the start tag, content, and end tag. The tag is just the markup itself.

mcqs.question: What is the purpose of the `<title>` tag in HTML?
options: To display a heading on the web page
To specify the title of the document shown in the browser tab
To create a tooltip for an image
mcqs.explanation: The `<title>` tag sets the text shown in the browser's title bar or tab.

mcqs.question: Which tag is used to define the main content of the HTML document?
mcqs.explanation: The `<body>` contains the main content, and `<main>` is a semantic element for the central content area.

mcqs.question: Which tag is used to define a list item?
mcqs.explanation: The `<li>` tag defines a list item in both ordered and unordered lists.

mcqs.question: Which tag is used to define a table row?
mcqs.explanation: The `<tr>` tag is used to define a row in a table.

mcqs.question: Which tag is used to define a heading in HTML?
mcqs.explanation: HTML provides six heading tags: `<h1>` to `<h6>`, with `<h1>` being the most important.
